definition: to root out/to eliminate the roots/to cure once and for all
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
lit. cut grass and pull out roots (idiom); fig. to destroy root and branch/to eradicate

sentences.english: Let us use it to end AIDS – once and for all.
sentences.chinese: 让我们借此势头，去消灭艾滋病，将它斩草除根。

sentences.english: We can never leave evil unchecked, we must remove the source of the trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不可养痈遗患，一定要斩草除根。

sentences.english: They truly believed that to remain was to risk extermination.
sentences.chinese: 他们确实相信留下来需冒着斩草除根的风险。

sentences.english: Love is like a shovel to the pain.
sentences.chinese: 爱心犹如一把铲能把痛苦斩草除根。

definition: to bring under permanent control/to effect a radical cure
variant of 痊癒|痊愈[quan2 yu4]
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to cure completely
to cure
sacrifice to drive away calamity/to dispel/to drive away/to remove
old illness/former affliction
to amputate/to excise (cut out)
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
to eliminate/to kill off
an incompletely cured illness/an old complaint/the root cause of trouble
cause of disease
to eradicate evil completely (idiom); thorough in rooting out wickedness
to apply a treatment/to undertake a therapy
draw out pus by applying a plaster to the affected area
